exampleContent.title: Rhyming Exercise Examples
exampleContent.description: Learn how to identify words that have the same ending sound (rhyme)
learningPoints: Rhyming words have the same ending sound
Listen carefully to the ending of each word
Words can rhyme even if they're spelled differently
Focus on the sound, not the spelling
Practice saying words out loud to hear the rhyme

sections.title: Basic Rhyming Patterns
sections.description: Learn to recognize common rhyming sounds and patterns

examples.explanation: All these words end with the 'at' sound. Even though they start with different letters, they rhyme because of their ending sound.
examples.audioGuide: Listen: cat, hat, bat, rat - they all end with the same sound

examples.explanation: These words all end with the long 'ee' sound, making them rhyme with 'tree'.
examples.audioGuide: Listen: tree, free, bee, see - notice the matching ending sound

examples.explanation: Words ending in '-ight' all have the same sound pattern and rhyme together.
examples.audioGuide: Listen: night, light, bright, sight - they share the 'ight' ending

sections.title: Sound vs. Spelling
sections.description: Understanding that rhyming is about sound, not spelling

examples.explanation: These words rhyme even though they're spelled very differently. 'Blue', 'through', 'new', 'flew', and 'grew' all have the same ending sound.
examples.spellingNote: Notice how 'blue', 'through', and 'new' are spelled differently but sound the same at the end.

examples.explanation: 'Eight' rhymes with words ending in '-ate' sound, even though it's spelled differently.
examples.spellingNote: The number 'eight' sounds like 'ate' at the end.

exercises.question: Which word rhymes with 'dog'?
exercises.explanation: 'Dog' and 'log' both end with the 'og' sound, making them rhyming words.

exercises.question: Which word rhymes with 'sun'?
exercises.explanation: 'Sun' and 'run' both end with the 'un' sound.

exercises.question: Which word rhymes with 'cake'?
exercises.explanation: 'Cake' and 'lake' both end with the 'ake' sound.

exercises.question: Which word rhymes with 'house'?
exercises.explanation: 'House' and 'mouse' both end with the 'ouse' sound.

exercises.question: Which word rhymes with 'bear'?
exercises.explanation: 'Bear' and 'chair' both end with the 'air' sound, even though they're spelled differently.
